amendment.description: Amendment to the Young (AK) substitute amendment (A001) sought to limit the average daily volume of oil exports for any calendar year to the total average daily volume of oil delivered through the Alaska pipeline during the previous year, less 1.3 million barrels per calendar day.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to the Young (AK) substitute amendment, printed as amendment No. 1 in the Congressional Record of July 21, 1995, to limit the average daily volume of oil exports for any calendar year to the total average daily volume of oil delivered through the Alaska pipeline during the previous year, less 1.3 million barrels per calendar day.

action.text: Amendment (A004) offered by Mr. Miller (CA) to the Young (AK) amendment (A001).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Miller (CA) amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 95 - 301 (Roll no. 556).
